snippet: Sports organizations are encountering more questions regarding inclusion of athletes with disabilities, but what is reasonable accommodation under the law has been debated.
abstract: High schools and youth sports organizations across the country are grappling with challenges in finding ways to accommodate students with disabilities; what is reasonable accommodation under the law has been debated when it comes to after-school sports; increased interest prompts Education Department's Office for Civil Rights to prepare additional guidance.
lead_paragraph: Sports organizations are encountering more questions regarding inclusion of athletes with disabilities, but what is reasonable accommodation under the law has been debated.

headline.seo: Disabled Athletes Suit Up, Raising Questions of Logistics and Fairness
headline.main: Forging Path to Starting Line for Younger Disabled Athletes
headline.print_headline: Forging Path to Starting Line For Younger Disabled Athletes
